intro: Saussurea ochrochlaena, commonly known as the yellow gentian, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stems and clusters of small, yellowish to orange flowers. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is known for its composite flower heads. Saussurea ochrochlaena typically grows in alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its botanical features make it an important species in the study of high-altitude flora.
